title: The Third Sector in Criminal Justice
abstractText:
The seminar series critically explores third sector (voluntary, charitable and non-governmental organisations) involvement in the criminal justice system and considers how it might develop over time. More specifically, it will:

  • review the current role of Third Sector Organisations (TSOs) in the criminal justice process
  • consider explanations for the growing involvement of TSOs in criminal justice
  • explore the potential for, and challenges to, integrating TSOs into the criminal justice process
  • explore the impact of TSOs' involvement in providing criminal justice services on their traditional roles and values
  • examine the contradictions between TSOs as service providers and campaigners for penal reform
  • explore the challenges of addressing social inclusion and diversity arising from TSOs involvement in providing criminal justice services
  • examine the use of research in evaluating the role of the third sector and consider the benefits and limitations of such research
  • identify gaps in existing knowledge about third sector involvement in criminal justice
  • develop a future agenda for research, policy and practice.

The seminars will explore a number of key themes affecting TSOs working in criminal justice including funding, diversity, workforce, expertise and infrastructure issues.

findingsText: Greater understanding of the Third Sector's role in criminal justice and possible future contributions.
